member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ConcurrencyCheckAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to mark the members of a Type that participate in optimistic concurrency checks.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.CustomValidationAttribute
member.summary: Validation attribute that executes a user-supplied method at runtime.
member.remarks:
This validation attribute is used to invoke custom logic to perform validation at runtime. Like any other , its method is invoked to perform validation. This implementation simply redirects that call to the method identified by on a type identified by
The supplied cannot be null, and it must be a public type.
The named must be public, static, return a bool and take at least one input parameter for the value to be validated. This value parameter may be strongly typed. Type conversion will be attempted if clients pass in a value of a different type.
The may also declare 2 additional parameters; a and an (out) . The input parameter provides additional context the method may use to determine the context in which it is being used. The output parameter allows the method to return a custom error message in the case the value is invalid.
If the method returns a null for or an empty then the normal method will be called to compose the error message.
The bool value returned by indicates whether a given value is acceptable. A true return means the given value is acceptable, and a false return indicates it is not.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute
member.summary: Base class for all validation attributes.
member.remarks: The properties and are used to provide a localized error message, but they cannot be set if is also used to provide a non-localized error message.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for any validation attribute.
member.remarks: This constructor chooses a very generic validation error message. Developers subclassing ValidationAttribute should use other constructors or supply a better message.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that accepts a fixed validation error message.
member.param: A non-localized error message to use in

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.#ctor(System.Func{System.String})
member.summary: Allows for providing a resource accessor function that will be used by the property to retrieve the error message. An example would be to have something like CustomAttribute() : base( () => MyResources.MyErrorMessage ) {}

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.SetupResourceAccessor
member.summary: Validates the configuration of this attribute and sets up the appropriate error string accessor. This method bypasses all verification once the ResourceAccessor has been set.
member.exception: is thrown if the current attribute is ill-formed.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.FormatErrorMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Formats the error message to present to the user.
member.remarks:
The error message will be re-evaluated every time this function is called. It applies the (for example, the name of a field) to the formated error message, resulting in something like "The field 'name' has an incorrect value".
Derived classes can override this method to customize how errors are generated.
The base class implementation will use to obtain a localized error message from properties within the current attribute. If those have not been set, a generic error message will be provided.
member.param: The user-visible name to include in the formatted message.
member.returns: The localized string describing the validation error
member.exception: is thrown if the current attribute is ill-formed.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.IsValid(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether or not the specified is valid with respect to the current validation attribute.
member.remarks:
Derived classes should implement their validation logic here.
The preferred public entry point for clients requesting validation is the method.
member.param: The value to validate
member.returns: true if the is acceptable, false if it is not acceptable
member.exception: is thrown if the current attribute is ill-formed.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.TryValidate(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult@)
member.summary: Tests whether the given is valid with respect to the current validation attribute without throwing a
member.remarks: If this method returns false, the output will be guaranteed to be non-null. Additionally, and will be guaranteed to be non-empty.
member.param: The value to validate
Additional context in which this test is being made. It cannot be null.
The output information describing the problem when this method returns false.
member.returns: true if the value is valid, otherwise false
member.exception: is thrown if the current attribute is ill-formed.
When is null.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.IsValid(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult@)
member.summary: Protected virtual method which can be overridden to perform contextual validation.
member.remarks: This implementation in the base class does not use the but merely calls the current object's . If that method returns false, this method constructs a using and the current attributes . Subclasses that want this behavior should invoke this base class's method. Subclasses that want to set explicitly should not invoke this base class's method.
member.param: The value to validate
Additional context in which the test is being made
Output information describing the problem if this method returns false
member.returns: true if the value is valid, otherwise false
member.exception: is thrown if the current attribute is ill-formed.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.Validate(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Validates the specified and throws if it is not.
member.remarks: This base method invokes the method to determine whether or not the is acceptable. If returns false, this base method will invoke the to obtain a localized message describing the problem, and it will throw a
member.param: The value to validate
The string to be included in the validation error message if is not valid
member.exception: is thrown if returns false.
is thrown if the current attribute is ill-formed.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.Validate(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the specified and throws if it is not.
member.remarks: This base method invokes the method to determine whether or not the is acceptable. If that method returns false, this base method will throw a containing the describing the problem.
member.param: The value to validate
Additional context that may be used for validation. It cannot be null.
member.exception: is thrown if returns false.
is thrown if the current attribute is ill-formed.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.ErrorMessageString
member.summary: Gets the localized error message string, coming either from , or from evaluating the and pair.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.ErrorMessageResourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource type to use for error message lookups.
member.value:
Use this property only in conjunction with . They are used together to retrieve localized error messages at runtime.
Use instead of this pair if error messages are not localized.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.ErrorMessageResourceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource name (property name) to use as the key for lookups on the resource type.
member.value: Use this property to set the name of the property within that will provide a localized error message. Use for non-localized error messages.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets and explicit error message string.
member.value: This property is intended to be used for non-localizable error messages. Use and for localizable error messages.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute
member.summary: DisplayAttribute is a general-purpose attribute to specify user-visible globalizable strings for types and members. The string properties of this class can be used either as literals or as resource identifiers into a specified

member.summary: Default constructor for DisplayAttribute. All associated string properties and methods will return nulls.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.GetShortName
member.summary:
Gets the UI display string for ShortName.
This can be either a literal, non-localized string provided to or the localized string found when has been specified and represents a resource key within that resource type.
member.returns:
When has not been specified, the value of will be returned.
When has been specified and represents a resource key within that resource type, then the localized value will be returned.
If is null, the value from will be returned.
member.exception: After setting both the property and the property, but a public static property with a name matching the value couldn't be found on the .

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.GetName
member.summary:
Gets the UI display string for Name.
This can be either a literal, non-localized string provided to or the localized string found when has been specified and represents a resource key within that resource type.
member.returns:
When has not been specified, the value of will be returned.
When has been specified and represents a resource key within that resource type, then the localized value will be returned.
Can return null and will not fall back onto other values, as it's more likely for the consumer to want to fall back onto the property name.
member.exception: After setting both the property and the property, but a public static property with a name matching the value couldn't be found on the .

member.returns:

When has been specified and represents a resource key within that resource type, then the localized value will be returned.
member.exception: After setting both the property and the property, but a public static property with a name matching the value couldn't be found on the .

When has been specified and represents a resource key within that resource type, then the localized value will be returned.

member.summary: Gets the value of if it has been set, or null.
member.returns:
When has been set returns the value of that property.
When has not been set returns null.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.GetAutoGenerateFilter
member.summary: Gets the value of if it has been set, or null.
member.returns:
When has been set returns the value of that property.
When has not been set returns null.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName
member.summary:
Gets or sets the ShortName attribute property, which may be a resource key string.
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the UI display string.
member.remarks:
The property contains either the literal, non-localized string or the resource key to be used in conjunction with to configure a localized short name for display.
The method will return either the literal, non-localized string or the localized string when has been specified.
member.value: The short name is generally used as the grid column label for a UI element bound to the member bearing this attribute. A null or empty string is legal, and consumers must allow for that.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Name attribute property, which may be a resource key string.
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the UI display string.
member.remarks:
The property contains either the literal, non-localized string or the resource key to be used in conjunction with to configure a localized name for display.
The method will return either the literal, non-localized string or the localized string when has been specified.
member.value: The name is generally used as the field label for a UI element bound to the member bearing this attribute. A null or empty string is legal, and consumers must allow for that.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Description attribute property, which may be a resource key string.
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the UI display string.
member.remarks:
The property contains either the literal, non-localized string or the resource key to be used in conjunction with to configure a localized description for display.
The method will return either the literal, non-localized string or the localized string when has been specified.
member.value: Description is generally used as a tool tip or description a UI element bound to the member bearing this attribute. A null or empty string is legal, and consumers must allow for that.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Prompt attribute property, which may be a resource key string.
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the UI display string.
member.remarks:
The property contains either the literal, non-localized string or the resource key to be used in conjunction with to configure a localized prompt for display.
The method will return either the literal, non-localized string or the localized string when has been specified.
member.value: A prompt is generally used as a prompt or watermark for a UI element bound to the member bearing this attribute. A null or empty string is legal, and consumers must allow for that.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.GroupName
member.summary:
Gets or sets the GroupName attribute property, which may be a resource key string.
Consumers must use the method to retrieve the UI display string.
member.remarks:
The property contains either the literal, non-localized string or the resource key to be used in conjunction with to configure a localized group name for display.
The method will return either the literal, non-localized string or the localized string when has been specified.
member.value: A group name is used for grouping fields into the UI. A null or empty string is legal, and consumers must allow for that.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the that contains the resources for , , , , and . Using along with these Key properties, allows the , , , , and methods to return localized values.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets or sets the order of the column. Columns are will be sorted in increasing order based on the Order value. Columns without this attribute have a default Order of 0. Negative values are allowed and can be used to place a column before all other columns.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.AutoGenerateField
member.summary: Gets or sets whether UI should be generated automatically to display this field. If this property is not set then the presentation layer will automatically determine whether UI should be generated. Setting this property explicitly allows to override the default behavior of the presentation layer.
member.remarks: Consumers of this method should utilize the method to retrieve the value. That method will return either return null if this property has not been set or the value that was used when setting this property.
member.exception: If the getter of this property is invoked when the value has not been explicitly set using the setter.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.AutoGenerateFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets whether UI should be generated automatically to display filtering for this field. If this property is not set then the presentation layer will automatically determine whether filtering UI should be generated. Setting this property explicitly allows to override the default behavior of the presentation layer.
member.remarks: Consumers of this method should utilize the method to retrieve the value. That method will return either return null if this property has not been set or the value that was used when setting this property.
member.exception: If the getter of this property is invoked when the value has not been explicitly set using the setter.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayColumnAttribute
member.summary: Sets the display column, the sort column, and the sort order for when a table is used as a parent table in FK relationships.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.LocalizableString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a localizable string, specifying the property name associated with this item. The value will be used within any exceptions thrown as a result of localization failures.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.LocalizableString.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears any cached values, forcing to perform evaluation.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.LocalizableString.GetLocalizableValue
member.summary: Gets the potentially localized value
member.remarks:
If has been specified and is not null, then localization will occur and the localized value will be returned.
If is null then will be returned as a literal, non-localized string.
member.exception: Thrown if localization fails. This can occur if has been specified, is not null, but the resource could not be accessed. must be a public class, and must be the name of a public static string property that contains a getter.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext
member.summary: Describes the context in which a validation is being performed.
member.remarks:
This class contains information describing the instance on which validation is being performed.
It supports so that custom validation code can acquire additional services to help it perform its validation.
An property bag is available for additional contextual information about the validation. Values stored in will be available to validation methods that use this

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.#ctor(System.Object,System.IServiceProvider,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Construct a ValidationContext for a given object instance, an optional , and an optional property bag of .
member.param: The object instance being validated. It cannot be null.
Optional to use when is called. If it is null, will always return null.

Optional set of key/value pairs to make available to consumers via . If null, an empty dictionary will be created. If not null, the set of key/value pairs will be copied into a new dictionary, preventing consumers from modifying the original dictionary.
member.exception: When is null

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.GetDisplayName
member.summary: Looks up the display name using the DisplayAttribute attached to the respective type or property.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.GetService(System.Type)
member.summary: See .
member.param: The type of the service needed.
member.returns: An instance of that service or null if it is not available.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.ObjectInstance
member.summary:
Gets the object instance being validated. While it will not be null, the state of the instance is indeterminate as it might only be partially initialized during validation.
Consume this instance with caution!
member.remarks: During validation, especially property-level validation, the object instance might be in an indeterminate state. For example, the property being validated, as well as other properties on the instance might not have been updated to their new values.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.ObjectType
member.summary: Gets the type of the object being validated. It will not be null.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the user-visible name of the type or property being validated.
member.value: If this name was not explicitly set, this property will consult an associated to see if can use that instead. Lacking that, it returns .

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.MemberName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the type or property being validated.
member.value: This name reflects the API name of the member being validated, not a localized name. It should be set only for property or parameter contexts. The type name will be used if MemberName has not been set.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.Items
member.summary: Gets the dictionary of key/value pairs associated with this context.
member.value: This property will never be null, but the dictionary may be empty. Changes made to items in this dictionary will never affect the original dictionary specified in the constructor.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult
member.summary:
Container class for the results of a validation request.
See

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Full constructor
member.param: The user-visible error message. If null, will use for its error message.

The list of member names affected by by this result. If empty, will construct this list from its . This list of member names is meant to be used by presentation layers to indicate which fields are in error.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that accepts an error message
member.param: The user-visible error message. If null, will use for its error message.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult.MemberNames
member.summary: Gets the collection of member names affected by this result. The collection may be empty but will never be null.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets the error message for this result. It may be null.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Validator
member.summary: Helper class to validate objects, properties and other values using their associated custom attributes.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Validator.TryValidateProperty(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult})
member.summary: Tests whether the given property value is valid.
member.remarks:
This method will test each associated with the property identified by . If is non-null, this method will add a to it for each validation failure.
If there is a found on the property, it will be evaluated before all other validation attributes. If the required validator fails then validation will abort, adding that single failure into the when applicable, returning a value of false.
If is null and there isn't a failure, then all validators will be evaluated.
member.param: The value to test
Describes the property member to validate and provides services and context for the validators.
Optional collection to receive s for the failures.
member.returns: true if the value is valid, false if any validation errors are encountered.
member.exception: When the of is not a valid property

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Validator.TryValidateObject(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult})
member.summary: Tests whether the given object instance is valid.
member.remarks:
This method evaluates all s attached to the object instance's type. It also checks to ensure all properties marked with are set. It does not validate the property values of the object.
If is null, then execution will abort upon the first validation failure. If is non-null, then all validation attributes will be evaluated.
member.param: The object instance to test. It cannot be null.
Describes the object to validate and provides services and context for the validators.
Optional collection to receive s for the failures.
member.returns: true if the object is valid, false if any validation errors are encountered.
member.exception: When is null
When doesn't match the on

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Validator.TryValidateObject(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tests whether the given object instance is valid.
member.remarks:
This method evaluates all s attached to the object instance's type. It also checks to ensure all properties marked with are set. If is true, this method will also evaluate the s for all the immediate properties of this object. This process is not recursive.
If is null, then execution will abort upon the first validation failure. If is non-null, then all validation attributes will be evaluated.
For any given property, if it has a that fails validation, no other validators will be evaluated for that property.
member.param: The object instance to test. It cannot be null.
Describes the object to validate and provides services and context for the validators.
Optional collection to receive s for the failures.
If true, also evaluates all properties of the object (this process is not recursive over properties of the properties).
member.returns: true if the object is valid, false if any validation errors are encountered.
member.exception: When is null
When doesn't match the on

member.summary: Tests whether the given value is valid against a specified list of s.
member.remarks:
This method will test each s specified . If is non-null, this method will add a to it for each validation failure.
If there is a within the , it will be evaluated before all other validation attributes. If the required validator fails then validation will abort, adding that single failure into the when applicable, returning a value of false.
If is null and there isn't a failure, then all validators will be evaluated.
member.param: The value to test. It cannot be null.
Describes the object being validated and provides services and context for the validators.
Optional collection to receive s for the failures.
The list of s to validate this against.
member.returns: true if the object is valid, false if any validation errors are encountered.

When is invalid for this property.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.Validator.GetValidationErrors(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttribute},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal iterator to enumerate all validation errors for an value.
member.remarks: If a is found, it will be evaluated first, and if that fails, validation will abort, regardless of the parameter value.
member.param: The value to pass to the validation attributes
Describes the type/member being evaluated.
The validation attributes to evaluate.
Whether or not to break on the first validation failure. A failure will always abort with that sole failure.
member.returns: The collection of validation errors.

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationAttributeStore

member.remarks: This internal class serves as a cache of validation attributes and [Display] attributes. It exists both to help performance as well as to abstract away the differences between Reflection and TypeDescriptor.
